biography: Maria de Kammerer, a native of Hungary, painted portraits in Europe and the United States. In her early teens before World War I, she was a pupil of Gyula Glatter, Hungary's leading portraitist of the period and won a place is the Royal Academy of Fine Arts in Budapest. While continuing her studies at London's Grosvenor School of Painting, de Kammerer began getting portrait commissions. She moved to the United State in 1931 and died in 1970.
